info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 24 at 8:33AM AKST until November 24 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
...ACCUMULATING SNOW FOR HAINES MONDAY...
A weak, decaying low pressure will bring moisture up from the south, generating snow showers for Haines, Lutak, Mud Bay, and the Haines Highway continuing through Monday afternoon. Highest uncertainty regarding this system is the depth of the moisture profile, which will dictate heavier rates. As of 8am, Amounts have ranged from 1 to 4 inches, with one report of 5 inches near Chilkat State Park at 400 ft elevation. Snow showers expected to continue through the afternoon with rates reaching 0.5 inches at times in heavier showers.
* WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches.
* WHERE...Haines, Lutak, and Mud Bay.
* WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As of 8 am, 1 to 5 inches of snow has fallen across the area. Snowfall is expected to continue through Monday afternoon, heaviest snowfall rates are expected Monday morning, with rates possibly exceeding 0.5 inches per hour at times.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING
